page.title: 19WOOBURN GREEN-VILLAGE GREEN
page.content: A large grassy area surrounded by shops and houses.It is focal point of village activities,like fetes.An annual fair is held in May.Many fine horse-chesnut trees surround the green and at one end is a War Memorial for the World Wars. The Queen and Albert pub was once a work-house and the Red Cow was once a wash house.Forge Cottage,once a black- smiths,is 400 yrs old and has been in the same family since 1885.The Roast Inn,recently modernised,was once an Elizabethean Coaching Inn.Most local inhabitants do some shopping on the Green.Many of the shops have retained their individuality,with friendly shop- keepers,such as Doug Young,who takes his paper boys on an outing,and will change a cheque for you.New shops round the Green include a video hiring centre and Off Licence and a betting shop.
